content:
Where is a good non-health-IT-nerd introduction to the Final Rule? I don't need the whole thing, just enough for this:

A colleague outside health IT works in the field of online dispute resolution: arbitration, credit card disputes, etc. I was telling him about the emerging age of patient visibility into their charts, and the probability that patient requests for corrections will be a big workload, hungering for automation, and I wondered if his work (e.g. their workflows) could be repurposed for use in health IT.

He asked for an overview, to share with his colleagues in the field. Thoughts?

Maybe it's just a couple of sentences.

Brendan Keeler said:

Nikita's is good non technical summary

Wow, best opening tagline ever: "Waiting Room is a blog that explains incentive misalignments in healthcare and health tech." How have I never heard of this??
